intro: Pentagonia costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican pentagonia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive pentagonal-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
